intro: Barroetea setosa, commonly known as the hairy barroetea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a pale yellow to greenish hue. Barroetea setosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
